column4: I have a problem with my wifi in my laptop (it's broadcom) I installed the fwcutter but it acts strange: it works (I have eth1 listed in ifconfig, it scans with iwlist scan), then when I enable roaming mode it still seems to work, but when I disable it again it stops working and it disapears from ifconfig, iwlist says eth1 doesn't support scanning.. do you think that this is a driver issue?
sounds normal to me.
ifconfig  [show network device names]
i don't think this is normal...
if you dissable the driver, you are essentially turning off the device.
and you won't see the network device name anymore.
that's badly written I meant I disable roaming mode... not the card
O
So, what command are you using to dissable roaming?
the gui config
I also set it to settings it was before (static IP, no WEP etc)
Then I don't know what the GUI app is really doing, but sounds like it's just unloading the driver.
so how should I disable the roaming mode from terminal?
What you need to do is set up multiple profiles and just switch from one to the other.
I don't know, just set the essid to a specific name, rather than "any" or what ever it is.
setting essid to "any" would be roaming mode, I think.
and you would control that with iwconfig.  e.g.  iwconfig eth1 essid linksys    or   iwconfig eth1 any
corrections: sudo iwconfig eth1 essid linksys    or  sudo iwconfig eth1 essid any
iwconfig   with no arguments will show current settings
strange is that card lists if I use iwconfig, but not with ifconfig (normally it lists also there)
May be that it will only show in ifconfig if it is connected to a live network.
haveing a wireless card running under ndsiwrapper will not have full range of functions.
